it.polimi.ingsw.is25am33.model.dangerousObj.DangerousObj

  • Field Details

    • direction

      protected Direction direction
      Represents the direction of movement or orientation of the dangerous object. This variable is of type Direction, an enumeration that defines the possible directions (NORTH, EAST, SOUTH, WEST). The direction determines how the object moves or interacts within the game environment.

    • coordinate

      protected int coordinate
      Represents the coordinate value of the dangerous object on a predefined game axis or grid. This variable is used to track the object's position and can be updated as it moves.

    • dangerousObjType

      protected String dangerousObjType
      Represents the type identifier of a dangerous object in the system. It is used as a discriminator for serialization and deserialization of subclasses that inherit from the DangerousObj class. The value of this field is set by specific subclasses, acting as a unique identifier for objects such as "bigMeteorite", "smallMeteorite", "bigShot", and "smallShot". This field is also utilized by serialization formats, such as JSON, to include the type information for polymorphic type resolution.

  • Constructor Details

    • DangerousObj

      public DangerousObj(Direction direction)
      Constructs a DangerousObj with a specified direction. Initializes the object's direction and sets its coordinate to 0.
      Parameters:
      direction - the initial direction of the DangerousObj

    • DangerousObj

      public DangerousObj()
      Default constructor for the DangerousObj class. Initializes an instance of DangerousObj without setting any specific direction or coordinate. This constructor can be used in situations where no initial configuration is needed.

  • Method Details

    • getDangerousObjType

      public abstract String getDangerousObjType()
      Retrieves the type of the dangerous object.
      Returns:
      a String representing the type of the dangerous object (e.g., "bigMeteorite", "smallMeteorite", "bigShot", "smallShot").

    • getDirection

      public Direction getDirection()
      Retrieves the direction associated with this dangerous object.
      Returns:
      the direction of the dangerous object, indicating its movement or attack orientation.

    • getCoordinate

      public int getCoordinate()
      Retrieves the current coordinate of the dangerous object.
      Returns:
      the current coordinate as an integer value.

    • setCoordinates

      public void setCoordinates(int coordinate)
      Sets the coordinate value for this dangerous object.
      Parameters:
      coordinate - the new coordinate value to be assigned
